comments:
Creating a new feature project and opened the feature.xml in the shiny new
feature editor.

Clicked on "Export", filled in the wizard, "Finish" -->  I get the error below :-(

Where did I go wrong?

Error Apr 26, 2004 16:48:50.856
C:\Eclipse\eclipse-N20040426\eclipse\runtime-workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.ui\temp\dev.properties
(The system cannot find the path specified)
java.io.FileNotFoundException:
C:\Eclipse\eclipse-N20040426\eclipse\runtime-workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.ui\temp\dev.properties
(The system cannot find the path specified)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.BaseBuildAction.getDevEntriesProperties(BaseBuildAction.java:196)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.getDevProperties(FeatureExportJob.java:204)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.makeScript(FeatureExportJob.java:192)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.doExport(FeatureExportJob.java:144)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.doExports(FeatureExportJob.java:119)
	at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.run(FeatureExportJob.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Fixed.
the build process now takes a properties file declaring the output folders for 
each plug-in.
The properties file was being created without making sure its parent exists.
*** Bug 59882 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
